taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Latin cimex, bug, and fugare, to drive away]

bio:treatment.discussion: Cimicifuga may be divided into two natural groups: those with seeds scaly and those with seeds lacking scales or nearly so. Cimicifuga racemosa and C. elata of North America, with scaleless seeds, are most closely related to C. biternata (Siebold & Zuccarini) Miquel and C. japonica (Thunberg) Sprengel of Asia.
Four or five species of Cimicifuga are cultivated as ornamentals, and at least five named cultivars have been developed.
